reviewText: This game is a BLAST! After going through an easy tutorial you are open to roam a large open-world on a vehicle you can spawn out of thin air, then come across random multiplayer events, like going through waves of enemies protecting an 'Ark', with other people (very epic). I especially LOVE the combat and gameplay, it is SOOO satisfying, for example:  Snipe a dude, throw a grenade, blow up an explosive barrel with enimies around it, then pull out a machine gun and go crazy while rolling inbetween corridors. Also the enviroments are AMAZING! like the Golden Gate bridge all broken and old, and i like the fact that what you see... YOU CAN EXPLORE! The graphics and story are also amazing for a F2P game and not to mention the game is completely FREE, and in my opinion it is Not Pay-to-Win either, YES you can by the coins that let you buy ingame items, but you can get the coins yourself and buy and sell using IN-game currency. Did not pay a Cent of real money. The ONLY downside is the servers are down alot and occasionally the server lags, but... WHO CARES? I Love this game, i made this review when i have played only 4 hours of the game and it is already my top 10 games list..... just try it out! *also, the TV show is complete and utter CRAP*

reviewText:
Defiance in my opinion is a solid free to play MMO. The game feels like they took the combat stylish gameplay from mass effect added in a borderlands looting system. And then to top it off gave it the overall feel of star wars the old republics MMO feel. The game is much more fun if you play with a friend and keep at the same pace.  To me the game is a little confusing at first. Gameplay / Mission wise if you didnt play from launch. (Because the game is alinned with the TV show defience and is added on with each season. ) it almost feels as if you just dont connect as well with the game.
Story wise the game is very weak i probably would understand it more if i watched the show but i just dont want to put the time into the series quiet yet. And another part i felt about the gae that hits the story hard is that almost all the characters voice acting sounds like the producers walked outside found some random hobo and said they would pay for his meal if he did one or two voices.
Another thing i must add is character customization is there just minimal.  just dont expect a level of cuztomization like skyrim or SWTOR.
BTW the game is much more fun if you play with a friend.
So really all in all despite a couple bugs (None game breaking) its a solid MMO/RPG to the genre. And since its free now theres no reason not to check it out. Defiance is a ton of fun and can give you a great time. Thank you!

reviewText:
I don't like MMOs. I have two main reasons for that:
1) Mechanics are always pretty much the same, point, click, skill hotkey, etc etc
2) Fantasy-Japanese-Medieval-Magic theme over and over again, with silly storyes and sexist characters.

Defiance has neither of them. Althought it shares common aspects of any other MMO, this game has a good controller suport, to start with.
I know it's not the first MMO shooter, but it delivers pretty well in that aspect, it vaguely reminds me of a MAss Effect X Borderlands feeling.

Now, the game has several problems, like being almost constantly laggish, enemyes have questionable AI and interfaces are quite confusing at the start.
But somehow this game got me coming back at it.

Another good thing is that I find myself useful in every event. In other games, as you join up early and powerless, your useless, but here I find myself on the top 5 players every time.
And that´s another great thing, now that it's free. Almost any event or just anywere you're going you'll end up having a lot of other players helping you out (by helping themselves out), and no argument and crying around about sharing the loot.

Story here is not great, but is quite engaging. Quests are a little repetitive (go somewhere, shoot enemyes, activate something), but it has kept me hooked.

I've never spent real money buying items for the games, but I might give it a try on this one, just to support it.

reviewText: I've gone through a lot of games, including a lot of shooters and MMOs, but I try to stick with games I consider rating at 8 or 9 out of 10. I think Defiance is a fantastic, amazing AAA game. I have no idea why the Metascore is so low, but I'm guessing it's because there was a hype machine associated with it both online and on television (SyFy) due to the fact that this game was produced alongside the TV series, and such hype machines tend to go overboard. There's a lot of action, some decent RPG elements, a decent shooter mechanic, AMAZING graphics, MMO scope, multiple storylines, and a changing world. It's not without occasional glitches, such as missions that don't complete correctly, but it's still a great game. Highly recommended.

reviewText:
Installed this yesterday evening and have clocked up 9.5hrs.

~When you first start it seems a bit low-budget and a bit like a B movie, I wasn't so sure at first, it just seemed a bit thrown together, but, if you stick it out until you've done the first few main story quests and stumble upon some public geared events you may well start to enjoy it.

There's plenty of players online that you bump into, random side quests and lots of public events you encounter when just travelling to and from your objective. In that respect it's been a fun few hours.

If I had to describe the game it's Mass Effect meets Destiny meets fallout with some RIFT style random events you get caught up in. Playstyle is very much like mass effect, it's third person offset camera, with basic run and roll / dodge but lacking the cover system. The way you run around dispatching enemies in various environments and zones reminds me of playing mass effect vs destiny, the hud animations when you collect items and interact are similar too.

There are quite a few similarities to Destiny whilst on that note. So if you are looking for a sci-fi fix of that type then take a look at this. I think Bungy had quite a bit of inspiration from this. I played Destiny from beta and release, leveled up a Hunter to 30 with all legendary and exotics, did all instances / strikes and put in a hell of a lot of playtime (then got bored and sold it along with the PS4) so I have seen all of it.

The environments the art style and post-apocolyptic battle of Defiance much like the (rather poorly explained) battle of the traveller and environments. Certain mobs look very much like the Knights and others (and raiders look nearly identical to some of the enemies on earth, mutants with swords charging at you very similar in idea to the vandals concept).

Scenery is of a very similar style, certain outfits and gear look similar, the HP system and hail-of-bullet style play and mob encounters are similar too. Even down to the rocket / thrust system on mounts and the way mounts are summoned and an AI 'ghost' style entity guiding you. I have the cloak ability and building on other specs similar to the hunter style play. There are certain things it does better too, like the fact that it IS open world, and not just some crappy restricted zone or 'patrol' style small planet map. The actual social aspect that was heavily lacking in destiny is in Defiance. I could actually see me getting more play time from this.

I'm not sure of the longevity of this game at the moment, there is a very big map and several continents to explore, I have travelled to quite a few zones already but I am still discovering places, I feel the combat may get a little tiring, but there are plenty of weapons and a lot of modifications that you can do to them (you can modify the stock, barrel, scope and ammo / magazine type).

There are a ton of micro-transactions, the store has a lot of gear you can purchase, but they have to make some money somehow since it's gone F2P right? The servers won't run themselves! I haven't found yet however that I need to buy anything, quests do the standard MMO thing and reward gear, be it weapons, outfits or shields / mods, so there is plenty to keep you going while you assess whether you really do like the game or not. And if you like it, why not buy a weapon or outfit, it's cheaper than a pint of beer...

Some good and bad points so far:


+ Graphics are very pleasent - nice effects, nice level of detail and terrain looks very good, models look good too

+ Well designed environments

+ High FPS - even on highest settings performance seems very good, never dropped bellow 60fps once, even with about 100 players on the screen in a total frag-fest

+ LOTS of action - if you like unleashing a hail of bullets and projectiles into enemies you will enjoy it

+ Lots of gear - Weapons, modifications and equipment available even without buying from the store

+ Zero server and connection lag experienced thus far

+ Good sound FX

+ Open world - no real set path, do anything you want and at your own pace

+ No leveling system - as such, this is a postive I believe, new players can instantly join in with veterans and have fun

+ Skill trees with lots of progression

+ If your into the series, this links in nicely and has episodic content that carries over to the game

+ Fast travel if you want to get somewhere in a hurry



- Widescreen users may experience 'vanishing' textures and objects on high settings - after some play time (memory leak?) although the game still looks great on medium and this problem will go away

- Story is a bit bland - not very well explained, not engrosing or that interesting in game

- Music - gets very annoying after a while, the combat music is limited to one track that really gets on your nerves, at least you can turn it off

- Some enemies have way too much hp - and not in a good way, IE in certain quests the mob won't kill you, you won't be worried at all but you will roll around shooting him for about 10 mins getting very bored with his never ending HP!


Overall if you have a few spare minutes, are bored and fancy just trying something new, then for free it is really worth a shot.

reviewText:
This game has few MAJOR problems because dev's wanted as many players/platforms into the game, but theres also alot of stuff i like in a game. Thats why i am still playing this. There has always been problems with different computers not performing as the best. So that is why this game needs serious fixing.
I recommend this because i like the consept of DEFIANCE, some pvp elements are quite fun, voice acting is good, story line is exquisite and someone has to get those arkfalls.

Pros.

1. Alot of players.
2. Very enjoyable gameplay. (exept sniper)
3. Dynamic events.
4. Challenges,contracts,missions everything i love in a game.
5. GUNS, LOTS AND LOTS of guns, one for every mind.
6. Loot system is quite good. (There is an in-game market, where you can buy lockboxes that contain weapons and other misc. items)

Cons.

1. Draw distance is horrible for pc players or anyone who enjoys sniping at long distances, you get invisible enemies after 100-150 meters. (PS3 and xbox360) Pc players could always look at the options and choose options that suits their systems.
2.  Not that much graphical options...
3.  Gameplay gets repetetive after 13-16 hours.
4. Market. This just sucks. You can actually buy lockboxes from there, those contain weapons and other misc. items. Sometimes this game feels like Pay to Win...
5. If there is too many enemies in one area you will only see the enemies and not the players... Makes it kinda hard for medics. For example one event there was about 40-60 players and suddenly there was only me against 40-50 enemies that suddenly lose health and die.

reviewText: Major things about Defiance: It is a free to play game and Third Person Shooter\n\nLet me get this out in the beginning of this review: Defiance is amazing+Free 2 Play! Wide variety of weapon choices, intruiging bosses, and its a show also! The money system (scrip) isn't that hard to get, and there is a good trade system between players and stores. The 5 different rarity levels go like this: White=Common, Green=Uncommon, Blue=Rare, Purple=Epic, and Orange is legendary! And if you want to edit your gun, you can! With Defiance's Salvage Matrix, you can change your weapon in a variety of ways: If the weapon has an EGO level above or below your's by 100, you can use ArkForge to level up/down any item. You can also change your gun's mods, which consist of barrel mods (ex. Power Bore ll), Magazine Mods (ex. Radiation Converter IV), Sight Mods (ex. Telescopic Sight V), and Stock Mods (ex. Close Quarters Stock I). All of these mods also have rarity levels (white, green, blue, purple, orange). Sometimes, guns don't come with all the mod slots. In order to fix this, you must have to click Add Mods" on the Ark Salvage screen. But beware
date: not all mods are for the same weapons. Defiance also has a PvP system
recommended: but it can sometimes be hectic. There are Shadow Wars and Competitve Maps. The reason I personally don't do PvP is because (a) The people are VERY good and (b) The weapons and abilities can be over powered. With that out of the way
hoursPlayed: let me talk to you about the feel of the shooting. I can't really tell you the word to describe Defiance's shooting system.................aha

reviewText: This game isn't bad actually.  I Bought it on the Winter sale for $4.99  and with over 30 hours in I certainly have gotten my money out of it.  That said the Server is Dead, when I look at how many people are in the game at one time on steam the most I have ever seen is 700 people.  That is really sad for an MMO.  I just play the game like it is a single player game and that is how I get my enjoyment out of it.  I would like to do more Like PVP battlegrounds, but I was in the queue over 3 hours last night just to get 8 more people to PVP.  I want to invest in the DLC, but I am afraid that this game is going to end up shutting down do to low populations.\n\nThe point is I do recommend the game as it has good game play but don't expect to see to many people at once.  I would like to see more people get into this game as I think it is a little under rated and does have good gameplay to it.  I would also hate to see it go away, because unfortunately that is where I see it heading with the empty servers.

reviewText:
Fantastic fun!
Saw this game on sale, which prompted me to watch the show, which hooked me and got me to buy the game for my girlfriend and I, and we have been playing non stop for the week since we got it.

First, the separate stories for the show and the game are interesting on their own. Then you add episodic missions with some of the same decent characters from the show and events that explain other events, such as where Nolan gets a particular artifact, and in one mission you technically save the city of Defiance. The game also has a nice long story line mostly independent of the show, fascinating in its own right. The game and show stand on their own no question, but if you follow both they cross over in fantastic ways and further illuminate the world.

Controls and combat are solid, what you would expect from a typical 3rd person action shooter, notably with unlimited dodge rolls but without a cover mechanic. The progression is also very nice, with a wide variety of weapons with not much difference between them, instead progressing by skill and based on how you can mod the weapons and how the weapons and mods synergize. There are also 4 core abilities and a plethora of perks" to unlock

reviewText: Defiance is an unique game.Its a very innovative MMORPG i like refreshing peaces of work like this.It combines some of the best things of some other games.It has an open world where you can do pretty much anything.It has a Co-op that is very good.It has a well thought PvP system and nice PvP events in the Open world area.It has tons of different weapons and on top of that any weapon can have a different kind of ammo and effect(nanoeffect).Which makes the game weapon wise very divers.The graphics are actually pretty good and the game does not lag that much for a game with good graphycs.The only downside of it is that the environment is too still...everywhere you go you switch between two different styles of backgrounds barren lands and alien plant green life.NOT MUCH DIVERSITY IN THAT ARE.Which can lead to Boredom. You have to choose from four different skills which are awesome.You can use one at a time but can pretty much have all of them and switch between them.Overall i would give the game an eight out of  a ten.I recommend it to all who are looking for something new and fresh!

reviewText:
For $10 you'll get your money's worth. The DLC's all bring about 1 good thing to table while the rest is neglible.

Castithan charge pack - The charge blades from the TV show, new weapons, and arena mode. Blades are cool. Weapons suck. Arena...meh.

Arkbreaker - ability to call down arkfalls and access to volge weaponry. Both of these are nice. New stuff to do in game and access to great weapons. Downside/upside (depending on your viewpoint) now everyone is essentially running around with a baby BFG from doom.

7th Legion - new faction, new outfits, titles, and weapons. Bad DLC. Been playing for a bit and still not seeing the big deal. I guess the samurai outfit just doesn't impress me that much. :-(

Gunslinger - new" storyline missions and similar goodies listed in 7th legion DLC. The "new" missions are really half of the old missions with a new/more detailed background to them. The DLC starts out interesting enough
date:
but trails off at the end. PvP and CO-OP maps redone for single player use. This is all it really amounts to. The story isn't really progressed all that much. You find out a tad more about e-rep and (!!!SPOILERS!!!) they are trying to be devious and underhanded and steal stuff. Surprised? Not really. Impressed. Not really. Overall rating of this DLC...B- to a C+


Overall the barebones game will get you far. If you want to get the DLC pick up the first two. Everything after doesn't really contribute. Still not sure? Wait until the finally one comes out and see if it justifies a season pass."

reviewText: While this game has some very good mechanics and can be alot of fun to play. The combat often come up frustrating in spades. While 99% of the combat is ranged the enemies have some very good melee dudes that really are good at getting in your face and busting your chops. reviewText:
Picked this game up for about $4 on sale and I must say, I've definitely got my money's worth from it with about 114 hours worth of gameplay at the time of writing this review.

This game plays out very much like an online Borderlands, for better or for worst. The game play is a pretty straight forward with a basic run and gun core gameplay. There are a wide variety of weapon types to choose from, allowing players the ability to customize their character exactly how they like them with no real restrictions as to what weapons can be used by which class or race. There are also a host of abilities that can be used to aid in breaking up the monotony of the run and gun format, much like Borderlands, but often times I have found that they are not essential to game progression. The world is large and feels adequately inhabited, with a number of random missions going on at all corners of the map at any given time. The map itself is gorgeous, with a fair amount of variety from region to region. There are also a number of different gamemodes available to offer a little variety with the world. Everything from time trials on ATV, to special events where you battle progressively more challenging enemies, to multiplayer PVP.

And now for the drawbacks. Because the game has the same gameplay mechanics as Borderlands, it can get very monotonous. For the most part, this is counterbalanced by a wide variety of weapons which offer different challenges when fighting enemies, but still the format of running around shooting enemies over and over can get boring. While there are a number of different random missions that crop up all across the map, giving you the opportunity to get additional money, the missions fall into only a few different categories and after a few hours of gameplay, will become less interesting and more of an annoyance due to the lack of variety. Another disappointing aspect is that while the weapon types are varied, the number of available weapons of each type are not so much. There is no real variety to the weapons themselves, unlike Borderlands. In Borderlands, if you found a specific weapon you liked, you could search for additional variants of the same type that offer additional perks or slightly varied stats. In Defiance, once you find a weapon you like, you're pretty much stuck with that same weapon. The only possible choices you have is to find some mods to give it a few additional stat bumps or find the same exact weapon in a more rare version for a few tacked on perks. There's no real variety and aside from personal preference, no obvious reason to choose on weapon over another. Finally, my last gripe is with the PVP... PVP can be a bit glitchy at times. Sometimes when you go to join PVP, its supposed to teleport you to the area where the PVP is going on, but it doesn't, leaving you to commit suicide to fast travel to PVP since often times its a few kilometers away. I've also seen the respawn screen glitch and not allow you to respawn. I waited nearly 10 minutes, with the sounds of the battle continuing in the background. The buttons would respond on mouse over and when clicked, but it would not allow me to respawn. I ended up having to restart the game to clear this fault.

Overall, for a pretty fun casual Borderland-esque game, I feel that it is worth the money, especially if you pick it up during a sale, but be warned that a lack of variety can make this game feel a little monotonous, especially on longer play sessions. Also, I hear that the game is a lot more fun if you drag along a few friends... I'd rate this game a solid 4.5 out of 5, since really only a few minor tweaks to the game could definitely improve the overall play value...

reviewText:
A pretty interesting MMO, has a kind of Borderlands feel to it. Defiance is basicly an open world shooter based on a tv series.
The game has an unique way of playing co-op where anyone at any time can join your quests and help you. The leveling in this game is also pretty unique where you don't actually have a level but you gain XP to spend on skill points. Gear does not have a level requierment so a low level could easily match up against a high level in PvP.
The graphics are not the best out there right now but do have it's own feel to them.
The vehicles in the game have a pretty good feeling to them, the sound of the vehicles could be redone though.
Not a lot of character customization or armors in this game and the cool cosmetic items cost real world money.
The game has a lot of areas and envoirments to explore and a lot of fun quests to do alone or with friends.
I can recommend this game mainly because it gives a lot of fun for small coin, and with no actual subscription as in you pay once and you can play forever makes this game a good purchase.

reviewText:
Solid, Fun MMO shooter that mechanically is similar to Borderlands. It is doing something that's never been done before, tying into a TV show on SyFy and events from the game influence the TV show and vice versa. The game has had it's fair share of hiccups, but Trion has done a good job with constant patches. A Huge DLC pack is set to come out late July. Game plays best if you join up with some friends. After 200 hours, I can say, Defiance is really, really fun. It's the first MMO I've been able to get into.

8.8 out of 10.

reviewText: Before I get into detail, I'd like to say I feel really sorry for those who bought this when it cost $60. This game is a free-roam shooter with many similarities to the Borderlands franchise. It's not the most amazing shooter you'll find, but I can definitely say you will get your money's worth now that it's at $10. It's kinda like borderlands styled co-op with MMO at the same time, you'll meet a LOT of new people and fight to compete in arkfalls, volge sieges, and considerably more. The leveling system is very slow in relation of start/max level (10/5000, I'm around 1500 now) and such is often also the case with finding new weapons, but the game does have updates, plenty is subject to change (they certainly have room to improve). Again, not the greatest game, but if you've got 10 to spend and want a new game to hang with friends in, this is a pretty good idea.

reviewText:
Installed this yesterday evening and have clocked up 9.5hrs.

~When you first start it seems a bit low-budget and a bit like a B movie, I wasn't so sure at first, it just seemed a bit thrown together, but, if you stick it out until you've done the first few main story quests and stumble upon some public geared events you may well start to enjoy it.

There's plenty of players online that you bump into, random side quests and lots of public events you encounter when just travelling to and from your objective. In that respect it's been a fun few hours.

If I had to describe the game it's Mass Effect meets Destiny meets fallout with some RIFT style random events you get caught up in. Playstyle is very much like mass effect, it's third person offset camera, with basic run and roll / dodge but lacking the cover system. The way you run around dispatching enemies in various environments and zones reminds me of playing mass effect vs destiny, the hud animations when you collect items and interact are similar too.

There are quite a few similarities to Destiny whilst on that note. So if you are looking for a sci-fi fix of that type then take a look at this. I think Bungy had quite a bit of inspiration from this. I played Destiny from beta and release, leveled up a Hunter to 30 with all legendary and exotics, did all instances / strikes and put in a hell of a lot of playtime (then got bored and sold it along with the PS4) so I have seen all of it.

The environments the art style and post-apocolyptic battle of Defiance much like the (rather poorly explained) battle of the traveller and environments. Certain mobs look very much like the Knights and others (and raiders look nearly identical to some of the enemies on earth, mutants with swords charging at you very similar in idea to the vandals concept).

Scenery is of a very similar style, certain outfits and gear look similar, the HP system and hail-of-bullet style play and mob encounters are similar too. Even down to the rocket / thrust system on mounts and the way mounts are summoned and an AI 'ghost' style entity guiding you. I have the cloak ability and building on other specs similar to the hunter style play. There are certain things it does better too, like the fact that it IS open world, and not just some crappy restricted zone or 'patrol' style small planet map. The actual social aspect that was heavily lacking in destiny is in Defiance. I could actually see me getting more play time from this.

I'm not sure of the longevity of this game at the moment, there is a very big map and several continents to explore, I have travelled to quite a few zones already but I am still discovering places, I feel the combat may get a little tiring, but there are plenty of weapons and a lot of modifications that you can do to them (you can modify the stock, barrel, scope and ammo / magazine type).

There are a ton of micro-transactions, the store has a lot of gear you can purchase, but they have to make some money somehow since it's gone F2P right? The servers won't run themselves! I haven't found yet however that I need to buy anything, quests do the standard MMO thing and reward gear, be it weapons, outfits or shields / mods, so there is plenty to keep you going while you assess whether you really do like the game or not. And if you like it, why not buy a weapon or outfit, it's cheaper than a pint of beer...

Some good and bad points so far:


+ Graphics are very pleasent - nice effects, nice level of detail and terrain looks very good, models look good too

+ Well designed environments

+ High FPS - even on highest settings performance seems very good, never dropped bellow 60fps once, even with about 100 players on the screen in a total frag-fest

+ LOTS of action - if you like unleashing a hail of bullets and projectiles into enemies you will enjoy it

+ Lots of gear - Weapons, modifications and equipment available even without buying from the store

+ Zero server and connection lag experienced thus far

+ Good sound FX

+ Open world - no real set path, do anything you want and at your own pace

+ No leveling system - as such, this is a postive I believe, new players can instantly join in with veterans and have fun

+ Skill trees with lots of progression

+ If your into the series, this links in nicely and has episodic content that carries over to the game

+ Fast travel if you want to get somewhere in a hurry



- Widescreen users may experience 'vanishing' textures and objects on high settings - after some play time (memory leak?) although the game still looks great on medium and this problem will go away

- Story is a bit bland - not very well explained, not engrosing or that interesting in game

- Music - gets very annoying after a while, the combat music is limited to one track that really gets on your nerves, at least you can turn it off

- Some enemies have way too much hp - and not in a good way, IE in certain quests the mob won't kill you, you won't be worried at all but you will roll around shooting him for about 10 mins getting very bored with his never ending HP!


Overall if you have a few spare minutes, are bored and fancy just trying something new, then for free it is really worth a shot.

reviewText:
This game has few MAJOR problems because dev's wanted as many players/platforms into the game, but theres also alot of stuff i like in a game. Thats why i am still playing this. There has always been problems with different computers not performing as the best. So that is why this game needs serious fixing.
I recommend this because i like the consept of DEFIANCE, some pvp elements are quite fun, voice acting is good, story line is exquisite and someone has to get those arkfalls.

Pros.

1. Alot of players.
2. Very enjoyable gameplay. (exept sniper)
3. Dynamic events.
4. Challenges,contracts,missions everything i love in a game.
5. GUNS, LOTS AND LOTS of guns, one for every mind.
6. Loot system is quite good. (There is an in-game market, where you can buy lockboxes that contain weapons and other misc. items)

Cons.

1. Draw distance is horrible for pc players or anyone who enjoys sniping at long distances, you get invisible enemies after 100-150 meters. (PS3 and xbox360) Pc players could always look at the options and choose options that suits their systems.
2.  Not that much graphical options...
3.  Gameplay gets repetetive after 13-16 hours.
4. Market. This just sucks. You can actually buy lockboxes from there, those contain weapons and other misc. items. Sometimes this game feels like Pay to Win...
5. If there is too many enemies in one area you will only see the enemies and not the players... Makes it kinda hard for medics. For example one event there was about 40-60 players and suddenly there was only me against 40-50 enemies that suddenly lose health and die.

reviewText: This game is a BLAST! After going through an easy tutorial you are open to roam a large open-world on a vehicle you can spawn out of thin air, then come across random multiplayer events, like going through waves of enemies protecting an 'Ark', with other people (very epic). I especially LOVE the combat and gameplay, it is SOOO satisfying, for example:  Snipe a dude, throw a grenade, blow up an explosive barrel with enimies around it, then pull out a machine gun and go crazy while rolling inbetween corridors. Also the enviroments are AMAZING! like the Golden Gate bridge all broken and old, and i like the fact that what you see... YOU CAN EXPLORE! The graphics and story are also amazing for a F2P game and not to mention the game is completely FREE, and in my opinion it is Not Pay-to-Win either, YES you can by the coins that let you buy ingame items, but you can get the coins yourself and buy and sell using IN-game currency. Did not pay a Cent of real money. The ONLY downside is the servers are down alot and occasionally the server lags, but... WHO CARES? I Love this game, i made this review when i have played only 4 hours of the game and it is already my top 10 games list..... just try it out! *also, the TV show is complete and utter CRAP*

reviewText:
Defiance in my opinion is a solid free to play MMO. The game feels like they took the combat stylish gameplay from mass effect added in a borderlands looting system. And then to top it off gave it the overall feel of star wars the old republics MMO feel. The game is much more fun if you play with a friend and keep at the same pace.  To me the game is a little confusing at first. Gameplay / Mission wise if you didnt play from launch. (Because the game is alinned with the TV show defience and is added on with each season. ) it almost feels as if you just dont connect as well with the game.
Story wise the game is very weak i probably would understand it more if i watched the show but i just dont want to put the time into the series quiet yet. And another part i felt about the gae that hits the story hard is that almost all the characters voice acting sounds like the producers walked outside found some random hobo and said they would pay for his meal if he did one or two voices.
Another thing i must add is character customization is there just minimal.  just dont expect a level of cuztomization like skyrim or SWTOR.
BTW the game is much more fun if you play with a friend.
So really all in all despite a couple bugs (None game breaking) its a solid MMO/RPG to the genre. And since its free now theres no reason not to check it out. Defiance is a ton of fun and can give you a great time. Thank you!

reviewText:
I don't like MMOs. I have two main reasons for that:
1) Mechanics are always pretty much the same, point, click, skill hotkey, etc etc
2) Fantasy-Japanese-Medieval-Magic theme over and over again, with silly storyes and sexist characters.

Defiance has neither of them. Althought it shares common aspects of any other MMO, this game has a good controller suport, to start with.
I know it's not the first MMO shooter, but it delivers pretty well in that aspect, it vaguely reminds me of a MAss Effect X Borderlands feeling.

Now, the game has several problems, like being almost constantly laggish, enemyes have questionable AI and interfaces are quite confusing at the start.
But somehow this game got me coming back at it.

Another good thing is that I find myself useful in every event. In other games, as you join up early and powerless, your useless, but here I find myself on the top 5 players every time.
And that´s another great thing, now that it's free. Almost any event or just anywere you're going you'll end up having a lot of other players helping you out (by helping themselves out), and no argument and crying around about sharing the loot.

Story here is not great, but is quite engaging. Quests are a little repetitive (go somewhere, shoot enemyes, activate something), but it has kept me hooked.

I've never spent real money buying items for the games, but I might give it a try on this one, just to support it.

reviewText:
Defiance,is a game,when you play it,you will get addited to it,it is a new open world,got main and side mission,u can optional follow main mission,or you keep chasing Special event to leveling ur level,It is just like MMO,but the fun part is,you need to discover urself where is the enemy weakness,when you play it,you will feel like,you are playing borderland,but don't mind,it is 3rd person shooting,for newbie,remenber always stick to other player.

reviewText:
Revised Review 04-12-2015

ike any game it has its quirks, but, overall, Defiance, is a PVE co-op player's game.

Sure there's PVP, but for we who do not PVP this game has something to do almost all the time.

You're ego can go from where you start at 1, to 5900, it gets rough around 4400ish and some of the ways to increase and max, basically your level, are things I won't do, like PVP.  So I'll never max my character, but I find reaching for 5000, and likely 5400 will be satisfactory.

Whatever you do find a place called Headlands transit.  Vehicles can be bought there for the game currency, make sure you get at least a duni.  And, when you can affor it, get a Dodge Caravan.  The Duni maneuvers well, you'll be surprised, but the Caravan hits hard, and a most morbid thrill for me is running around killing mutants with my vehicle haha

If you're into zombies, seek out the afflicted, and make sure you get a BMG weapon.  You'll be laughing over and over every time you use it against afflicted, not the most powerful weapon, but that's relative anyway.

Defiance uses a scaling system, those who play Rift will be familiar with this. and the scaling system can make life a pain, but that usually means better rewards.

And, as far as metacritic is concerned, I look at it this way.  64 is 14 over 50, and with most game reviewers being PVP elitists, they will never give Defiance a great review, always slightly above average because their PVP bias weighs so heavy in their scoring compared to the game itself.

You can't find a better game to play that's free, that has a lot to do, has great clans and great atmosphere, is sci-fi, has aliens and zombies, had a pretty good sized map, has just a lot going for it as a real game, with a storyline that generally follows (a season behind) a syfy television show, with good cut scenes and voice acting.

Oh and, no requirement of ground travel to towns, once you find it you double-click and are there.

Additionally, and I don't care who thinks this is unrealistic" no damage from falling

reviewText: Love this game, almost all the players are great. you can follow the storyline or you can go play with other players or you can play with other players going through the storyline. there is so much space on the server that it can easily uphold the stress all the players put on it. there are also various challenges and minigames that you can do. there are several ways to earn the money that you use and you can trade items with other players. there are only a few confusing  things in the game, but the players will help you and sometimes, literally, walk you through the parts you are having difficulty with. This game is great. I have only had the server lag one day when the servers were updated with some incompatible software. The problem was located, isolated, and fixed when I logged on the next day. so the maintenance crew is great. Awesome game.

reviewText:
The Defiance is a 3rd person shooter with a very realistic graphics and fast-paced action. In terms of game mechanics, it is purely identical to Borderlands.

However, with all the potential for interaction, adventure and intrigue derived from the TV series, it COULD HAVE BEEN SO MUCH MORE. Instead of a unique taste of the Arch, we receive another copy of Fallout: New Vegas, but drastically simplified. Lack of distinct classes, professions, specialties and crafting, as well as lack of dynamic universe, economics, personal wealth (only cash and cosmetic gear), zones of control and conflicting factions is imho a drawback, not an advantage. The few options for character's development are all explored very quick, and the game becomes repeatable.

This game has a vast potential of evolving into a perfect and detailed ♥♥♥♥♥♥me, but as of today, it will only satisfy shooter genre fans. I recommend the game for its great graphics, cool multiplayer map events and its potential for future development. I have high hopes that the game will be continually upgraded.

reviewText: I really enjoy playing the game in short bits. Very entertaining at first. After a while it becomes too linear. I only made it to about 4000 EGO level (out of 6000) but there really is nothing left to keep playing towards. It felt similar to how Borderlands gameplay progressed. Once you've seen all the (very similar) fights, you just do the same thing over and over in hopes that the enemies drop better weapons. No crafting, no skill required after you master the mechanics about 20 hours into playing.\n\nPVP is a nightmare for low levels. They immediately pit you against other players who deal 30x the amount of damage you can. I stopped playing after about 200 hours simply because there is nothing left to do.

reviewText: Writing from a PS3 standpoint, Defiance is a great game in which you appreciate the community action in which you can team up with others to take on naturally occuring events. The Action is great, there are many stories and the opportunities are endless. Not many options for creativity of choice, character customization is blah, skill set up is weak and bland (EGO system) and the graphics are par.

reviewText:
This game is awesome, simply put. I put off playing it for a long time because I had played it on the 360 in its beta stages, and although i liked it, when it released i never bought it.

I heard it went free to play but still never played it when finally bordom got the better of me and i sifted through the free to play library over and over, constantly seeing defiance. I downloaded, creeated my account and hopped in. The first thing i noticed was that for an old (ish) game the graphics were still very pleasing. Sure theres some rough edges but thats to be expected. I played about 10 hours into the story, and somehow this game had not only hooked me, but got me immersed into the worlds story, and history. It made me do something i've never doen before, and that's watch a programme ;p

I sat down and watched the first season of Defiance (the show) and oh my I was impressed. Whenever I watched the show I wanted to go play the game and vice versa. Both entities complimented each other, and whenever I had watched an episode when I went in game I felt more involved, like I had a reason why I was trying to save the planet.

Never has an mmo hooked me into its world, I mean even ESO didn't achieve that for me, so I appluad Trion.

Now onto the gameplay. Its a great third person shooter in short. You have acces to a wide variety of weaponry, smgs, assault rifles, shotguns, snipers, rocket launchers... You name it. Unlocking some dlcs brings even more flavour to the show, which I have done and which I highly recomend, while its on sale after all. If you have watched any of the show you wll be happy to know that the charge blade makes an appearance, and to obtain it you must comoplete a series of very fun arenas in my honest opinion. It opens a whole new play style as you can now effectivley play as a melee player.

Other fun weapons such as infectors (shoots bugs) projectile based weaponry and charge up weapons all make this packaged all the more exciting.

You also have to use cover,  A LOT. This is what makes this mmo a lot more fun for me, you need to be aware of your surroundings and you can't just stand still and spam your gun/abilities. There's a dodge mechanic, that can put you out of harms way from bullets and selected enemy charge up attacks, and it is also used to put out any negative effect on your character quicker, such as being set on fire or being slowed down by something.

Onto the world. from what I have explored, big, 3 continant type areas and a smaller area (i think is dlc i have not been there yet) Some areas are bleak looking and some are full of life, yes some areas look a bit empty but for the most part the world is fun to explore. Data recorders are spread throughout the map in hidden and out of reach areas so if you are into that type of thing you will feel right at home.

What brings the world to life though are the dynamic events, you will find many random encounters where you must complete a series of objectives to gain a reward. Save some prisoners, disable this, collect that etc. These are fun and a good time waster, but its the arkfalls that seal the deal. All players can see the icons on the map so going to one is normally chaotic. These really are one of the (sadly) few end game events however I was playing them at the start of my game, any one can play them and make a difference. These can be very fun and rewarding and make for a great time.

Accesing the world is very easy. You can fast travel to any hub area you have already traveled to and (which suprised me) you gain access to a vehicle VERY early on, which isn't really seen in many mmos. Time trails are present for the avid driver and driving mechanics are fun, they arnt just slapepd into the game like they dont belong, all the vehicles have different handling and whats great is you can buy the fastest ones with ingame currency.

IS IT F2P OR P2W?
f2p for sure, you can buy inventory slots etc and suppl cases with real money but you can buy the same cases with in game currency so no one is at a disadvantage.

Trion got a lot of flak for this game and I don't know why. It's solid, great fun and if you find a clan, very rewarding.

IS THE GAME DEAD??
From what I have seen? No, Just last night I went to a war master (boss major arkfall) and I turned up first with like 3 other people... 2 minutes later a good 70 people flocked down and omg it was MENTAL! Enemies seem to scale with the number of players so it was very difficult but everyone banded together and afterwards we all traded items that we got as drops and rewards. A truly great moment in my gaming history

9/10 - Not the best UI, diverse enemies but quite a few repeatable missions. Other than that, BUY IT BUY IT BUY IT!!
Ummmm I mean, DOWNLOAD it... For free... What have you got left to lose ArkHunter?

reviewText:
Defiance is a free to play shooter MMO that defines massive CO-OP experience. You can customize weapons and vehicles to help you hunt for alien technology across a transformed Earth. In this game you don't fight alone, you fight with other players, you help each other to fight the monsters and upgrade your equipments.

Things I liked:
- Gameplay
- Graphics
- Weapons handling and customization
- Free To Play
- Big community
- Figthing monsters
- Vehicles
- Singleplayer-ish story mix

reviewText:
Seriously, this is one of the best ♥♥♥♥♥♥mes out there in my opinion. Its a great combination RPG and third-person shooter, with a very well balanced mix of open world cooperative and pvp gameplay.

There are plenty of missions broken up into different categories. Main story missions, side missions, some repeatable, some not. As well as both coop and pvp missions. So no matter if your a lone player, or playing with friends, there is enough in Defiance to keep everyone happy. Oh, and we can't forget Arkfalls, huge cooperative battles between a boss and the players in the open world.

The gameplay and game mechanics are best compared to Borderlands. Weapon and item nano (elemental) effects, weapon customization, lock boxes similar to the loot crates in Borderlands, and fully customizable skill (Ego) tree.  Lots of different vehicles to drive, weapons to own, different outfits and titles to wear, there is plenty of customization available for most anyone.

The game is not too easy, but not too hard, it seems very well balanced. The graphic and sound quality is quite good and it seems to run very well on a wide range of machines.

If you're looking for a rather unique MMO RPG shooter experience, then Defiance is a must, even if you're not a fan of the SyFy series, there is still a LOT of fun to be had in this game.

reviewText:
Revised Review 04-12-2015

ike any game it has its quirks, but, overall, Defiance, is a PVE co-op player's game.

Sure there's PVP, but for we who do not PVP this game has something to do almost all the time.

You're ego can go from where you start at 1, to 5900, it gets rough around 4400ish and some of the ways to increase and max, basically your level, are things I won't do, like PVP.  So I'll never max my character, but I find reaching for 5000, and likely 5400 will be satisfactory.

Whatever you do find a place called Headlands transit.  Vehicles can be bought there for the game currency, make sure you get at least a duni.  And, when you can affor it, get a Dodge Caravan.  The Duni maneuvers well, you'll be surprised, but the Caravan hits hard, and a most morbid thrill for me is running around killing mutants with my vehicle haha

If you're into zombies, seek out the afflicted, and make sure you get a BMG weapon.  You'll be laughing over and over every time you use it against afflicted, not the most powerful weapon, but that's relative anyway.

Defiance uses a scaling system, those who play Rift will be familiar with this. and the scaling system can make life a pain, but that usually means better rewards.

And, as far as metacritic is concerned, I look at it this way.  64 is 14 over 50, and with most game reviewers being PVP elitists, they will never give Defiance a great review, always slightly above average because their PVP bias weighs so heavy in their scoring compared to the game itself.

You can't find a better game to play that's free, that has a lot to do, has great clans and great atmosphere, is sci-fi, has aliens and zombies, had a pretty good sized map, has just a lot going for it as a real game, with a storyline that generally follows (a season behind) a syfy television show, with good cut scenes and voice acting.

Oh and, no requirement of ground travel to towns, once you find it you double-click and are there.

Additionally, and I don't care who thinks this is unrealistic" no damage from falling

reviewText:
This game is awesome, simply put. I put off playing it for a long time because I had played it on the 360 in its beta stages, and although i liked it, when it released i never bought it.

I heard it went free to play but still never played it when finally bordom got the better of me and i sifted through the free to play library over and over, constantly seeing defiance. I downloaded, creeated my account and hopped in. The first thing i noticed was that for an old (ish) game the graphics were still very pleasing. Sure theres some rough edges but thats to be expected. I played about 10 hours into the story, and somehow this game had not only hooked me, but got me immersed into the worlds story, and history. It made me do something i've never doen before, and that's watch a programme ;p

I sat down and watched the first season of Defiance (the show) and oh my I was impressed. Whenever I watched the show I wanted to go play the game and vice versa. Both entities complimented each other, and whenever I had watched an episode when I went in game I felt more involved, like I had a reason why I was trying to save the planet.

Never has an mmo hooked me into its world, I mean even ESO didn't achieve that for me, so I appluad Trion.

Now onto the gameplay. Its a great third person shooter in short. You have acces to a wide variety of weaponry, smgs, assault rifles, shotguns, snipers, rocket launchers... You name it. Unlocking some dlcs brings even more flavour to the show, which I have done and which I highly recomend, while its on sale after all. If you have watched any of the show you wll be happy to know that the charge blade makes an appearance, and to obtain it you must comoplete a series of very fun arenas in my honest opinion. It opens a whole new play style as you can now effectivley play as a melee player.

Other fun weapons such as infectors (shoots bugs) projectile based weaponry and charge up weapons all make this packaged all the more exciting.

You also have to use cover,  A LOT. This is what makes this mmo a lot more fun for me, you need to be aware of your surroundings and you can't just stand still and spam your gun/abilities. There's a dodge mechanic, that can put you out of harms way from bullets and selected enemy charge up attacks, and it is also used to put out any negative effect on your character quicker, such as being set on fire or being slowed down by something.

Onto the world. from what I have explored, big, 3 continant type areas and a smaller area (i think is dlc i have not been there yet) Some areas are bleak looking and some are full of life, yes some areas look a bit empty but for the most part the world is fun to explore. Data recorders are spread throughout the map in hidden and out of reach areas so if you are into that type of thing you will feel right at home.

What brings the world to life though are the dynamic events, you will find many random encounters where you must complete a series of objectives to gain a reward. Save some prisoners, disable this, collect that etc. These are fun and a good time waster, but its the arkfalls that seal the deal. All players can see the icons on the map so going to one is normally chaotic. These really are one of the (sadly) few end game events however I was playing them at the start of my game, any one can play them and make a difference. These can be very fun and rewarding and make for a great time.

Accesing the world is very easy. You can fast travel to any hub area you have already traveled to and (which suprised me) you gain access to a vehicle VERY early on, which isn't really seen in many mmos. Time trails are present for the avid driver and driving mechanics are fun, they arnt just slapepd into the game like they dont belong, all the vehicles have different handling and whats great is you can buy the fastest ones with ingame currency.

IS IT F2P OR P2W?
f2p for sure, you can buy inventory slots etc and suppl cases with real money but you can buy the same cases with in game currency so no one is at a disadvantage.

Trion got a lot of flak for this game and I don't know why. It's solid, great fun and if you find a clan, very rewarding.

IS THE GAME DEAD??
From what I have seen? No, Just last night I went to a war master (boss major arkfall) and I turned up first with like 3 other people... 2 minutes later a good 70 people flocked down and omg it was MENTAL! Enemies seem to scale with the number of players so it was very difficult but everyone banded together and afterwards we all traded items that we got as drops and rewards. A truly great moment in my gaming history

9/10 - Not the best UI, diverse enemies but quite a few repeatable missions. Other than that, BUY IT BUY IT BUY IT!!
Ummmm I mean, DOWNLOAD it... For free... What have you got left to lose ArkHunter?

reviewText: Before everyone/anyone decides to say, I am warning you right now: If you don't like this game for certain reasons, then thats fine by me. However, for those of you who constantly bash this game after not even plying it or giving it a fair chance, I'll say this right now: QUIT YOUR WHINING AND DEAL WITH IT! THIS GAME WAS MADE THE WAY THEY INTENDED TO. NOW SHUT UP ALREADY! Now, down to the review. Defiance is honestly in my opinion one of the more interesting mmo type games out there. To me, it offers more than what you want to expect out of it, which in my case, is a really good thing since it adds more playability to the game. I would go into the details of how good this game is to me, but honestly, if you really want to know, play it yourself and find out. Also, one last thing before I end this review. I want everyone who plays this game to know and give me your suggestions about this game versus Destiny. When I mean suggestions, I mean the pros and cons that these games have other each other in terms of good or bad. Besides that though, if you do decide to comment on that subject, then feel free to go ahead and do so. I'm mainly asking because I think Destiny does have a     lot of problems and good things to it like Defiance. Also, if you do comment, don't just sit there and say that this game is better just because it is.\n

reviewText: Let's start with the fact that Defiance have it's issues. It's a licensed console-oriented game that was rushed a bit and had it's troubles - it's not ignored totally, and on the way to improve (albeit slowly)\n\nI do recommend it  though, especially now that the price went down to $10/$7.50 in 4-pack. reviewText: I really enjoy playing the game in short bits. Very entertaining at first. After a while it becomes too linear. I only made it to about 4000 EGO level (out of 6000) but there really is nothing left to keep playing towards. It felt similar to how Borderlands gameplay progressed. Once you've seen all the (very similar) fights, you just do the same thing over and over in hopes that the enemies drop better weapons. No crafting, no skill required after you master the mechanics about 20 hours into playing.\n\nPVP is a nightmare for low levels. reviewText:
This game is a prime example of how NOT to make a free to play game.  Absolutely everything that you ever hated about every other cheap console title is present here. My list of complaints could go on for days on end, but lets try to narrow it down to what made me review it negatively shall we?

Pay To Win... Need I say more. Sure you can unlock things for free, but everything from (the few armors that look good) to weapons people obviously spent money maxing out the rarity is only going to be obtainable through your wallet book. The most despicable thing about that concept is that it effects PvE AND PvP heavily. People who cranked out the dough early on will have a significant edge over people who haven't spent a dime. You'll next to NEVER kill someone who's either spent money making their weapon gold or farming for like 90 days+   and 90 days by the way is for those who are extremely lucky with the lockboxes.

Next order of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ttery...  Certain enemy types.  See your armor will break the more that you take damage. Fine right?  WRONG!!! Every faction nearly has that ONE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t enemy that either has a really cheap homing attack like the bug archers who snipe your ♥♥♥.  The pink missile launching  Volge, or the weird robots that dig their hands into the ground and instantly hit you from wherever you stand.  Once you have a certain amount of damage done unto you, you'll be going down time and time and time and INFURIATING time again. I've never wanted to snap my controller in half more with any other game than this one right here.  There's a difference between challenging and flat out stupid.  Even MLG pro players who obviously cranked out mommy's tax returns still somehow manage to occasionally go down at the hands of end game leveled mobs.

While the game is a scifi free roam MMO shooter, (& that's a huge turn on.)  It utterly FAILS at such basic things. Collision detecting is a big thing. You could be driving along when all of a sudden the SMALLEST lips in the world completely cut off your momentum. Or your vehicle will explode having hit cover near an arkfall! Ever wanted to get COMPLETELY stopped dead in your tracks by running straight into a Stop Sign? Well this is the game for you then! Cause  of all things you would expect to be destructible (signs)  they're not, and if you hit them you come to a complete stop. The driving is just hideous and controls like a 500 lbs. bowling ball!

The voice acting and animations I've seen for this are so cheesy. At one point you'll meet a black man who's CLEARLY voiced by a white man, & its just sooo awkward! Awkward infact, is a very accurate word used to describe the campaign which fails to make you give a ♥♥♥♥ about. Even sad moments are just so cheesy you just end up laughing in disgust. These devs are so lazy that they actually take armor THAT YOU PAY FOR from the cash shop and re-color it and offer it to you again either for more money or the less attractive ones can be earned through some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t pursuits. And when I say pursuits I really mean like a LIST, a full blown LIST of things you have to do.  Kill 50,000 enemies? Yeah go ♥♥♥♥ yourself!  The laziness will begin to show even more so when you start side questing and you realize just how many times they re-use and recycle areas.  You'll go back and fourth from one place getting this, talking to this guy, pressing this switch and the combat isn't even enough to keep you interested for the first 10 quests let alone the HUNDREDS. I wouldn't mind fetch questing if there were simply more to do.

Arguably the only 2 things the devs did right here is these things called Incursions & Arkfalls. These things are big events you can see going on in your map. It attracts HUNDREDS of players to that area & the sheer chaos is what has kept me addicted. Nowhere ever before have I seen SO many players in one area fighting so many enemies. It's beautiful! It's some of the best war scenes you never seen in games OR movies! The epic scale warfare is so good in fact that the downfall of it all is the last thing about it that's actually positive.   Your guns are all customizable. You can put mods on, upgrade rarity, choose from a massive list of perks. The heavy detail you can go into your powers and how your gun operates is really well done. So well done that its going to show in PvP or PvE & that's the one thing I cannot stand about this game. Absolutely NOTHING amounts to skill.  It's all about your build. If you've gotta good build (which in most cases is paid for) you'll demolish. If not..... Have fun grinding away DAYS of your life trying to get good.

What upsets me the most about this game is that the focus is nowhere near where it needs to be. Why does the game have to follow or even be parallel to the events of the show? Why can't it just be a standalone game within the Defiance universe every so often showing a main character.  Instead of investing ANY time at all into a campaign they could have focused their WHOLE game around this awesome principle of uniting hundreds of players and expanded upon it. So fellow Defiance players if you're reading this... Imagine if they had included tanks, jets, or even HALF of the vehicles you SEE parked in the game.  At the very least they could've let your partner (who's riding passenger) lean our the passenger side window and shoot.  Car chases could've been a thing for fetch questing like freaking GTA!  They could've even taken it a step further and had squad leaders determine which contracts (aka quests) to complete and then raid fully detailed buildings instead of what we're left with. (Which is buildings you see.... but can never go into.)   I'm just so tired at the half ♥♥♥ attempt to be a free roam scifi roleplaying shooter.  I salute the devs to be one of the first games to do this next to Firefall & Borderlands, but some of the most basic things you would expect from ANY game are just absent here.  If you attempt to contact the devs stating your gripes, they'll be sure to ignore you and then nerf an exploit that you found to be helpful in your progression. Surely this is why you see ABSOLUTELY NO uploaders on YouTube still covering this game anymore.

My verdict is simple. I won't recommend it (so that explains the thumbs down) but I will say that if you're bored and have nothing else better to do with your life. This can provide you some cheap fun.  I have not a single clue why developers keep making us fight bugs (which is so dumb) but you'll encounter those, zombies, robots, raiders, aliens, religious bigots, and dozens of other poorly voiced characters and factions. It has a sure amount of diversity and the free roam with the inclusion of vehicles is very nice. Just note that this method of rinse and repeat WILL get old. And it will get old VERY quickly...   Good luck Ark Hunter.  You'll need it!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Ok this is going be quite a lengthy review but after playing both the PC and PS3 ports of Defiance I fell like I can give a valid review. NOTE: (Also to consider Defiance WAS a paid MMO until the developers changed it to a free-to-play games without refunding people who brought the original digital and physical copies of the game. But for this review I will ONLY be talking about the game. Not the crap customer service of Trion. )
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PROS
- Solid gunplay
One thing does do right is how guns feel to shoot and handle in the game. Sniper feel like snipers, SMG's feel like SMG's. Nuff said.

-Good world art design which matches the sci-fi theme

The open world and art design might not be your cup of tea, but it's fair to say that it suits the futuristic apocalyptic setting of Earth. (For the most part of the game)

- Arkfalls, 4 player co-op

In my opinion these are currently the two best game modes/events in Defiance. Arkfalls events are dotted across the map and sees you gun down waves of braindead AI enemys for easy loot and XP. These consist of minor arkfalls which happen 24/7 or major arkfalls which makes you fight a boss which will kick your ♥♥♥ if you're not careful. But seriously, get pwned by a boss with friends can be a blast. Also I recommended if you're new to the game, ♥♥♥♥  the story and drive off to some arkfalls. Your EGO level and in-game money balance will thank me later ;)

4-player co-op is probably my favourite game mode which justifies the 16GB+ game download. You and 3 others are sent to some underground bunker or enemy base to massacre every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in sight but unlike arkfalls when you can do sweet FA and still get good rewards, 4-player co-op requires at least a bit of skill and teamwork to avoid all of your team getting incapacitated".


CONS

-  Story- The less said about the weak nonexistent drab storyline the better
date: And let's not even get started on the cutscences and awful voice acting. If you're the kinda of person who likes treading on LEGO pieces barefoot
recommended: and drinking toliet cleaner then the Defiance storyline is for you! t For your own wellbeing and sanity
hoursPlayed: avoid unnecessary story missions at ALL costs
voteText:
you have been warned.

-S*it b"battle" music
The person who made the annoying INFINITELY looping battle music should be fired and sent to North Korea. It's sounds like it was ripped from a episode of Seinfeld and not made for a sci-fi futurstic 3rd person shooter.

S*it DLC
Save your money. Nuff said

Small player base

Trion deserver a medal for how any people they have managed to ♥♥♥♥ off with their shady tactics and crap customer service. Because of his the player base has massively decreased over time so you'll probably either see vets and die hards players oe the handful of new players. There are still people online just not as many. Well done Trion
helpfulPercent:
well ♥♥♥♥ing done.

S*it UI

Using a mouse and keybaord? Well ♥♥♥♥ you then.

Too many damn currencies

Want that sweet weapon or cool car? Well ♥♥♥♥ you then. You need to get pointless rep OR you could burn £15 on "bits"

Overall is hard to recommend Defiance because of many flaws listed above however it's still a solid game at the core and has/had SOO much potential that this could of been so much better.  I have had cloked over 300 hours on the PS3 port of the game so you can consider me as a diehard but even still the shady business descions of trion are hard to ignore.

reviewText:
Horrible game.

It isnt just the stability issues, the pvp imbalances and exploits, the lack of significant content that becomes all too quickly repetitive,  the lackluster DLC(s) with delays(first took close to 5 months of multiple delays before releasing, the poor support, and more.

No.

It is, at its core, Trion's complete and utter consistency with which they have mismanaged, every step of the way this game to the point that problems are the norm, not the exception.

The recent December 10th DLC 2 release (also 5 months of hobbling/delaying) has riddled the game with yet another round of issues, nonsensical changes, and instabilities.  Even allowing players to test" it didnt change the the release of it making the testing rather pointless.

Dont buy into the "well it has potential":  8+ months in and these issues getting worse should indicate quite adequately for that to not be the case.

150+ dev staff that worked on this game up to launch were now reduced to nothing after 75% staff layoff round followed 2 months later with its studio closing.  Since then(and since the take over of Scott Hartsman as CEO of Trion) the game has continued to degrade.

And according to Forbes
date: this was an 80 million dollar budgeted game.  AAA in budget.... D- in result.\n\nAvoid this game
hoursPlayed: if it goes free to play
voteText: or otherwise.  If you already own it thinking for 5 bucks you couldnt do worse(yet you can)
helpfulPercent: dont waste your money on any of the DLC's or season's pass. Trion has more than adequately proven that they are incapable of redeeming this title or their reputation."

reviewText: Honestly, a game that should have had more content. A great core system, and unique gameplay.\n\nDefiance, a new, fresh sapling, planted in the grove of TV shows, small among the larger titles, microscopic. However, it began to grow quickly, soon bringing ample fruit to Syfy. It began to grow and grow, to be almost as large as the others. The fruits were rich, and the tree ever-growing. Then, they decided to try something. Another group, another sapling, grown to intertwine with the first tree, creating a masterpiece, whilst also adding more fruit to their harvest. The second tree swiftly grew, as large as the first, maybe even larger. Both trees kept growing, and producing their fruit. Soon, though, the largest tree began to stop producing its fruit. Syfy decided it would be best to simply cut it down. They took it, leaving the younger tree alone. The tree still flourished, its fruit just as sweet as ever. That was soon to end. The tree was built upon the foundations of its elder. It was never supposed to stand on its own. It slowly began to stop growing, and slowly, its fruit, too, began to decline. The Developers tried desperately to keep it alive, to keep it well. Soon, they even went so far as to allow people the fruit, without charge. This slowly began to help, but it would never be enough to recover. The tree still dies, and there is only one thing that could save it. If they were to begin the cycle again, by planting the seed of Defiance, letting it grow in place of the elder, and supporting the other tree. Both would flourish, producing its sweet fruit again, for both the Developers, and Syfy. However, Syfy has a different plan. Planting trees that swiftly produced sub-par fruit, and die as quickly as they are grown. None surpassing the duo known as Defiance. Syfy seems to be ignoring the looming issue, that Defiance seems to have been one of the few decent trees they had planted, and they had ignored it, and simply cut it down as it began to decline.

reviewText:
As a priced game, I am not sure if this would be worth your money. But as a free game? You have to try this. Even if you don't like the story, poor acting, repetitive music or other many other things. The gameplay was done better than most of the triple A games that you see now. Even though it's boring, there is a sense of addiction that keeps bringing you back. Free to Play or Pay to Play More? You'll still have fun, and this game won't treat players who don't pay as second class players. If anything the paying players may be at more of a disadvantage.

Still recieves updates. They recently added an entire but undeveloped (so far) large Island called Silicon Valley and it's not a DLC. Potential of things to come.

EDIT: I forgot to mention that this doesn't feel heavily like an MMO, the elements are there but it's not too distracting. More often than not you will appreciate having other players with you.

Overall review: Meh but if you have some time to kill give it a once over.

reviewText:
Defiance is a Free to Play science fiction-themed persistent world massively multiplayer online third-person shooter developed by Trion Worlds. Defiance takes place on a terraformed Earth several decades into the future. It is a tie-in to the Syfy show of the same name.  It uses the Trion Worlds Glyph launcher and you can use 1 Glyph account to access all the games on Trion Worlds.

I am not a fan of the show and have not watched Defiance on Syfy tv channel, maybe watched total of 30 minutes. I loaded this game just long enough to get a feel for it and write a review.

You can choose a Human or Irathient of either gender for free. Have a ok physical appearance creator system, you can change from the neck up.
You are an Ark Hunter so you have an EGO system  (Environmental Guardian Online) as your special powers, guide, gps, hud, communicator, perks, leveling device and damage shield.

Looks like it has a main story and side stories. Has a lot of storyscenes, voiceacting, characters from the TV show.  Looks like it leads you ok from mission to mission.  Has 5 DLC packs.  Has crossover missions that brings the TV show to the game.  Has player item trading system and 7 currencies.

You need to be good at gun shooting and movement to play this game. You have 2 weapon slots and a grenade slot per each loadout, have 2 loadouts. Has a free  single rider ATV for you to drive and there are driving challenges too. Has some 3 other vehicles types that you can spawn and drive for certain missions.

Has plenty of AI bot targets to shoot, they jump and move at random while attacking, run out of building to surprize you and respawn rapidly.  The Headshot is your friend here, it does the most damage or one shot kill. Body shots tend to be low damage and take a lot of body hits to kill targets.  The whole world is a PvE Co-op map, It has 4 player Co-op maps. Has 4 PvP maps and a PvP event.

It would be great for fans of the Defiance show, and gamers that like shooter games.

reviewText:
At first this is fun, even if you never saw the show. But after a day or so you quickly realize how boring this is going to get.

The perks are simple.
1. An open world, low skill based MMO. I've taken on enemies I probably shouldn't have and survived. And much like GW2, a far better game in my opinion, you don't NEED a party to help each other out.

The negatives are a little more.
1. It doesn't require that much skill honestly, repetitive missions.
2. Seriously sick of killing numerous bugs and bandits over and over and over and over and over and......getting it?
3. If there are tutorials for 75% of what you should know, I can't find them. What I have had to do is exit the game and go watch a plethora of youtube videos just to get an idea of what the hell is going on.
4. Anyone who tells you the graphics are awesome, should go back to consoles and stay there. This game looks like it came out in 2003.
5. I fell 1000 meters and didn't die, yes that's a complaint. It's showing a huge flaw in the simplest aspects of a game.

FInally, the biggest negative is the world. It's Earth, but not Earth. It's been 'partially' terraformed? That doesn't make a lick of sense. Lightsabers make more sense.

In the end, you might like to keep it around for a quick and easy way to blow off steam, but there are better games out there even for free.

reviewText: Definately a fun game. While the community isnt growing, the devs still care about the players are release content constantly. HOWEVER: DO NOT go into this game thinking it's free, since it was a previous pay to play game, it definately has microtransactions. I bought the game before it was f2p for $15, and when they switched over to f2p, i got a few exclusives, but it was enough to keep in the fight for leaderboards and not fall behind people who constantly spent money. I would recommend putting in a little bit of money just to be able to do some extra stuff (something useful though, not a weapon crate or anything, but something like the keycode capacity upgrade, or something along the lines of that.) and if you don't want to, at least get the DLC, its actually something worth buying, not like a COD map pack or anything. The game itself plays similar to Destiny, constantly grinding, but still a ton of stuff to do. It also follows along with the TV show, so as new seasons come out, so do new missions.
